meanings.definition: A person who sells small items or food, typically in an aggressive or dishonest manner.
meanings.sent1: The hucksters at the market were shouting loudly to attract customers.
meanings.sent2: The hucksters set up their stalls filled with trinkets and snacks.
meanings.sent3: The hucksters tried to convince everyone that their apples could make people fly!
meanings.sent4: The hucksters' words were like colorful balloons, floating with promises.
meanings.sent5: The image of the hucksters' sly smiles stayed in the minds of the passersby.

meanings.definition: To promote or sell something aggressively or dishonestly.
meanings.sent1: She hucksters her products by exaggerating their benefits.
meanings.sent2: The company hucksters their new gadget through misleading advertisements.
meanings.sent3: He hucksters his magic potion as a cure for all troubles, even bad hair days!
meanings.sent4: The politician hucksters his promises like a snake oil salesman.
meanings.sent5: The salesman hucksters his wares with a silver tongue and a false smile.
